hero.description_text: Entdecken Sie die Magie von Wadi Rum mit mir, Mohammad. Geboren und aufgewachsen in dieser mystischen Wüste, folge ich den Spuren meiner Vorfahren, die Jäger in diesen uralten Bergen waren. Meine Liebe zur Wüste ist tief verwurzelt, und ich möchte diese Leidenschaft für Wadi Rum mit Ihnen teilen. Lassen Sie mich Sie durch Felsen, Dünen, Sand und alte Karawanenrouten führen und Ihnen Orte zeigen, die Ihre kühnsten Träume übertreffen werden. Kommen Sie und erleben Sie die Magie von Wadi Rum mit mir.
hero.description_text_short: Entdecken Sie die Magie von Wadi Rum mit mir, Mohammad. Kommen Sie und erleben Sie den Traum von Wadi Rum.

about.about_paragraph: Hallo! Ich bin Mohammad, dein Guide im magischen Wadi Rum Wüste. Ich wurde hier geboren, genau wie mein Vater, Großvater und viele Vorfahren vor mir, die die Wüstenwege beschritten und in den Bergen jagten, die ich dir zeigen möchte. Als echter Beduine trage ich die Wüste in meinem Herzen und in meinem Blut. Ich möchte mit dir teilen, wie echte Beduinen leben, unsere Traditionen und unsere tiefe Verbindung zu diesem Land. Begleite mich auf eine Reise, die dein Leben verändern wird.

history.history_paragraph: Wadi Rum ist ein atemberaubendes Wüstental im Süden Jordaniens. Diese UNESCO-Weltkulturerbestätte ist berühmt für ihre unglaublichen Felsformationen, die durch Wind und Erosion geformt wurden. Mit seinen hohen Sandsteinbergen, tiefen Tälern und weiten Sanddünen ist die Landschaft wirklich beeindruckend. Bekannt als das „Tal des Sandes“, ist Wadi Rum reich an Geschichte und Kultur, die Heimat von nomadischen Beduinen und antiken Felszeichnungen. Diese einzigartige Wüste diente als Kulisse für Filme wie „Lawrence von Arabien“, „Der Marsianer“ und „Star Wars: Der Aufstieg Skywalkers“.

tour.tour_paragraph_1: Maximiere deinen kurzen Aufenthalt mit einem rasanten Abenteuer zu den Top-Attraktionen von Wadi Rum. Perfekt für diejenigen mit begrenzter Zeit, stellt diese Tour sicher, dass du nichts verpasst.
tour.tour_paragraph_2: Entdecke das Beste von Wadi Rum mit einer aufregenden Jeeptour am Tag und einer magischen Nacht unter den Sternen oder in einem gemütlichen Wüstencamp. Ein unvergessliches 24-Stunden-Wüstenabenteuer erwartet dich!
tour.tour_paragraph_3: Begib dich auf eine epische Wanderreise durch die atemberaubenden Landschaften von Wadi Rum—wo jeder Schritt die raue Schönheit der Wüste offenbart und ein unvergessliches Abenteuer auf dich wartet.
tour.tour_paragraph_4: Verliebe dich in die abgelegenen Ecken von Wadi Rum auf dieser erweiterten Tour. Verbringe zwei volle Tage mit Erkundungen und zwei Nächte beim Campen unter den Sternen, um die Magie der Wüste in vollen Zügen zu genießen.

faq.faq_answer_1: Um nach Wadi Rum zu gelangen, kannst du etwa 4 Stunden von Amman oder 1 Stunde von Aqaba bis ins Dorf Wadi Rum fahren. Es gibt einen Busservice zum Dorf Wadi Rum, aber bitte beachte, dass Busse selten fahren und normalerweise nur einmal am Tag. Sobald du im Dorf ankommst, hole ich dich persönlich mit meinem Jeep ab und nehme dich mit auf die Tour. Am Ende der Tour sorge ich dafür, dass du sicher ins Dorf zurückgebracht wirst.
faq.faq_answer_2: Busse nach Wadi Rum werden oft von der JETT (Jordan Express Tourist Transportation) Gesellschaft betrieben und fahren vom Südbusbahnhof (Mujamma Janoub) in Amman ab. JETT ist ein zuverlässiger Betreiber, der planmäßige Verbindungen zu verschiedenen Zielen in Jordanien anbietet, einschließlich Wadi Rum. Diese Busse fahren in der Regel einmal am Tag. Es wird empfohlen, den aktuellen Fahrplan und die Verfügbarkeit im Voraus zu überprüfen, da sie unregelmäßig sein können. Sobald du im Dorf Wadi Rum ankommst, werde ich dort sein, um dich mit meinem Jeep für deine Wüstentour abzuholen.
faq.faq_answer_3: Zu den wichtigsten Dingen gehören bequeme Kleidung, feste Schuhe, ein Hut, Sonnencreme, Sonnenbrille und eine Kamera. Für Übernachtungen solltest du warme Kleidung mitbringen, da die Temperaturen in der Wüste nachts stark sinken können.
faq.faq_answer_4: Du kannst Wadi Rum das ganze Jahr über besuchen, da seine Schönheit in jeder Jahreszeit beeindruckt. Im Frühling (März bis Mai) und Herbst (September bis November) sind die Temperaturen mild und ideal, um die Wüste zu erkunden. Allerdings kann die Schönheit von Wadi Rum in jeder Jahreszeit genossen werden, jede bietet ihren eigenen einzigartigen Charme und ihre eigene Erfahrung.
faq.faq_answer_5: Du kannst Jeeptouren, Kamelritte, Wandern, Klettern, Heißluftballonfahrten und Sternenhimmelbeobachtungen genießen. Es gibt auch Möglichkeiten, die Beduinenkultur zu erleben und in traditionellen Wüstencamps zu übernachten.
faq.faq_answer_6: Eine typische Wadi Rum Wüstentour beinhaltet den Transport von und nach Wadi Rum, eine geführte Jeeptour zur Erkundung der Wüste, Besuche ikonischer Orte wie Lawrence's Quelle und antiker Felsformationen, Mahlzeiten (je nach Tourpaket) und optionale Aktivitäten wie Kamelritte oder Übernachtungen in Beduinenlagern.
faq.faq_answer_7: Ja, Wadi Rum ist ein sehr sicheres Reiseziel für Touristen. Die lokalen Führer sind mit der Gegend vertraut und sorgen für deine Sicherheit während der Touren. Es ist wichtig, ihren Anweisungen zu folgen und die natürliche Umgebung zu respektieren.
faq.faq_answer_8: Um in Wadi Rum zu bezahlen, solltest du sicherstellen, dass du Jordanische Dinar (JD) in bar bei dir hast, da es in der Wüste keine Geldautomaten oder Kreditkarteneinrichtungen gibt.

all_tours.paragraph: Join me on an unforgettable journey through the stunning desert of Wadi Rum. I can take you on exciting jeep rides over golden dunes, peaceful camel walks under the open sky, or guided hikes to hidden corners of the desert — all with Bedouin tea prepared on a campfire during the day. We'll spend the nights under a sky full of stars, sipping Bedouin tea and enjoying traditional Bedouin food. Every experience is a chance to connect with the ancient landscape and Bedouin heritage. Let me help you create memories that will stay with you forever. The tours are conducted in English

one_day_tours.heading: 1 Day Tours
one_day_tours.paragraph: Discover the magic of Wadi Rum
one_day_tours.tour_parahraph_1: Short on time? This 2-hour jeep tour is perfect for a quick yet unforgettable adventure in Wadi Rum. I’ll take you to iconic sites such as Lawrence’s Spring, the majestic Khazali Canyon, the stunning Red Sand Dune, and the Little Rock Bridge. Experience the thrill of climbing the dunes and capturing amazing photos of the desert landscape. Of course, no visit to Wadi Rum is complete without a refreshing cup of traditional Bedouin tea prepared on the open campfire.
one_day_tours.tour_parahraph_2: This half-day jeep adventure is perfect for those who have the whole morning or afternoon to live the best of Wadi Rum. Over four hours, we'll explore some of the desert's most amazing locations, including the ancient Anfishiyeh Inscriptions, the famous Umm Fruth Rock Bridge, and the serene Wadi Abu Khashaba. You'll see the famed Lawrence’s Spring and Khazali Canyon. Between stops, we’ll stop to enjoy a cup of Bedouin tea by the fire and feel the tranquil desert atmosphere.
one_day_tours.tour_parahraph_3: See the heart of Wadi Rum with this full-day jeep expedition. Explore the striking Khashaba Canyon with its unique sandstone colour patterns, climb sand dunes, and climb iconic rock bridges featured in Hollywood movies. Explore the largest natural arch – Burdah Rock Bridge and fall in love with the desert's wild, untamed beauty. Along the way, we'll pause for a traditional Bedouin lunch and take our time to contemplate the tranquility of the desert. And, of course, we will prepare Bedouin tea on the open fire!
one_day_tours.tour_parahraph_4:
Step back in time and experience Wadi Rum the traditional way — on camelback. This way you can explore the desert at a leisurely pace, just as we the Bedouins have done for centuries. Enjoy stunning views from atop your camel as you cross sand dunes and visit the beautiful places of the desert. This is a perfect way to enjoy serene desert landscapes. You can easily add camel ride to any of the tours.

one_day_one_night_tours.description_tour_1:
Step into the enchanting Wadi Rum desert with a half-day jeep tour, perfect for those arriving in the late afternoon or evening. As you begin your journey, the desert's golden hues begin to shift as the sun starts to set, casting a magical glow over the rugged landscape. Your adventure kicks off with a visit to Khor Al Ajram Valley, where you'll traverse through wide-open expanses surrounded by towering sandstone cliffs. The jeep takes you to Lawrence’s Spring, a historic site with natural water sources where you can enjoy a serene pause. From here, the route leads to Wadi Khazali (Khazali Canyon), a narrow gorge adorned with ancient inscriptions and petroglyphs that tell stories of the desert's past inhabitants.

The journey continues to the Red Sand Dune, where you can climb to the top for a panoramic view of the surrounding desert. The route then brings you to the Little Rock Bridge, a natural sandstone arch, and Anfishiyeh Inscriptions, where centuries-old carvings in the rock are a testament to the region’s rich history. Next, you'll traverse the Umm Fruth Rock Bridge, a larger and more iconic arch that offers an exhilarating opportunity for a short climb.

As the day draws to a close, you'll witness the sunset over the dunes, painting the desert in a palette of reds and purples. After a day of exploration, unwind with a warm Bedouin tea by a crackling fire, followed by a hearty Bedouin dinner. You’ll spend the night under a canopy of stars or in a cozy desert camp, lulled to sleep by the tranquil sounds of the desert. Wake up to a peaceful morning and enjoy a delicious breakfast surrounded by the serene beauty of the desert, completing a truly unforgettable experience.
one_day_one_night_tours.description_tour_2:
Maximize your Wadi Rum adventure with a full-day jeep tour that immerses you in the desert’s highlights. Your journey begins with a drive through Khor Al Ajram Valley, a dramatic and expansive valley that sets the tone for the adventure ahead. The first stop is Lawrence’s Spring, a historical site offering a glimpse into the life of the Bedouins and the legendary Lawrence of Arabia. As you continue, you'll arrive at the Red Sand Dune, where you can climb to the top and marvel at the vastness of the desert below.

Next, the tour takes you to Wadi Khazali (Khazali Canyon), a narrow canyon rich with ancient inscriptions and carvings. This passageway reveals stories from the past, etched into the rock walls. The jeep then brings you to the Little Rock Bridge, where the natural arch formation provides a stunning backdrop for photos. Continuing on, you’ll explore the , a secluded spot where you can take a short hike through the canyon’s narrow passages.

The highlight of the tour is the visit to Burdah Rock Bridge, the largest natural arch in Wadi Rum, where you can admire the vastness of the desert from this impressive vantage point. The route also includes a stop at the surreal Mushroom Rock, a unique sandstone formation shaped by centuries of wind and erosion.

After a day filled with exploration, enjoy a traditional Bedouin lunch and unwind with tea breaks amidst the stunning landscapes. The day ends with a picturesque sunset, where the desert transforms into a canvas of vivid colors. As night falls, you’ll indulge in a delicious Bedouin dinner and spend the night under the stars or in a traditional camp. Wake up to a refreshing breakfast, ready to take on another day of desert beauty.
one_day_one_night_tours.description_tour_3:
Embark on an epic two-day adventure through Wadi Rum, where the thrill of off-road exploration meets the serenity of a full-day hike and a night under the stars. This journey is crafted for those who seek a deeper connection with the desert, offering a perfect blend of adventure and tranquility.

Day 1: Jeep Tour & Overnight Camp
Your adventure begins with a full-day jeep tour through the most iconic and remote areas of Wadi Rum. The journey starts with a drive through Khor Al Ajram Valley, a dramatic landscape of towering sandstone cliffs and expansive sand plains. Here, you’ll experience the true scale of the desert as you traverse its rugged terrain. The first stop is Lawrence’s Spring, a historic site where you’ll delve into the legacy of the legendary Lawrence of Arabia and the Bedouin tribes who have thrived in this harsh environment for centuries.

From here, continue to Wadi Khazali (Khazali Canyon), a narrow passageway rich with ancient petroglyphs and inscriptions. As you walk through the canyon, you’ll encounter carvings that depict scenes from everyday life, offering a glimpse into the desert’s deep history. The tour then takes you to the Red Sand Dune, where you can climb to the top for a panoramic view of the surrounding desert, a perfect spot for stunning photos.

Next, you’ll visit the Little Rock Bridge and the Umm Fruth Rock Bridge, two awe-inspiring natural arches sculpted by centuries of wind and erosion. These sites provide unique photo opportunities and a chance to marvel at nature's artistry. The jeep tour also includes stops at remote areas, where you’ll experience the solitude and vastness of the desert while savoring a traditional Bedouin lunch amidst breathtaking scenery.

As the day winds down, head to your desert camp, where you’ll be welcomed with warm Bedouin hospitality. Unwind with a cup of sweet Bedouin tea and enjoy a traditional dinner around a crackling campfire. As night falls, the desert sky comes alive with countless stars, offering a mesmerizing celestial display. You can choose to sleep in a cozy Bedouin tent or under the open sky, enveloped by the tranquil beauty of the desert.

Day 2: Full-Day Hike & Departure
The second day begins with an early breakfast to fuel your adventure. The hike starts with a challenging trek to Jebel Al Hash, where a climb rewards you with stunning panoramic views of the desert below. Traverse through varied terrain, from sandy plains to rocky outcrops, showcasing the diverse landscapes of Wadi Rum.

After descending from Jebel Al Hash, continue your hike through the lesser-known areas of Wadi Rum, away from typical tourist paths. Pass through Khashaba Canyon, a serene and secluded spot where the silence of the desert is almost palpable. Enjoy a packed lunch amidst the stunning landscape, with ample time to absorb the sights and sounds of the desert.

The hike concludes in the late afternoon as you return to your camp or pick-up point, leaving you with unforgettable memories of Wadi Rum’s epic landscapes and the profound peace that comes from exploring its remote corners.

hiking.paragraph: Discover the magic trails of Wadi Rum
hiking.description_tour_1:
Jebel Umm Al-Dami, the highest peak in Wadi Rum, has long been a symbol of majesty and endurance. Its name translates to “Mother of the Blood” in Arabic, referencing local legends and its imposing presence in the desert. Historically, it has served as a landmark for nomadic Bedouins and traders traversing the desert, guiding them through the vast expanse of Wadi Rum.

Our half-day adventure begins from Wadi Rum village, where you’ll meet your guide and set out towards the base of Jebel Umm Al-Dami. As we drive through the desert, the grandeur of the peak becomes evident.

The hike takes you through diverse terrain, from sandy stretches to rocky paths, offering a true sense of the desert’s rugged beauty. As you ascend, your guide will share stories of the peak’s historical significance and its role in the lives of ancient desert dwellers.

Upon reaching the summit, you’ll be greeted by breathtaking panoramic views of the desert stretching to the horizon. The clear sky and expansive views perfectly embody the “Summit of the Stars,” making this climb a memorable blend of adventure and natural wonder.

After soaking in the stunning vistas, we’ll return to Wadi Rum village, where you’ll have gained a deeper appreciation for the desert’s heritage and beauty in a compact yet impactful journey.

Optional Add-On:
Camel Ride and Hiking Tours can be added to any tour at any time.
hiking.description_tour_2:
Jebel Al-Hish stands as a sentinel in the Wadi Rum desert, a prominent peak known for its rugged grandeur and rich historical significance. This striking mountain is part of the larger Jebel Rum massif and has been a landmark in the region for centuries. The name "Al-Hish" translates to "the ridge" in Arabic, reflecting its prominent position in the landscape.

Historically, Jebel Al-Hish has been a waypoint for desert travelers and Bedouins, offering a crucial reference point amidst the vast desert. Its towering presence has been a part of local folklore and a beacon for those navigating the ancient trade routes that once crisscrossed this desert expanse.

Begin your half-day adventure from Wadi Rum village with our experienced guides. After a short drive, you'll arrive at the base of Jebel Al-Hish, ready to tackle the trail.

The hike features a blend of sandy stretches and rocky paths, showcasing Wadi Rum’s diverse landscape. As you ascend, your guide will share fascinating stories about the mountain’s historical significance and its role in ancient desert trade.

Reaching the summit, you'll be rewarded with sweeping views that make the desert appear like a mirage. This hike is a perfect blend of history, challenge, and stunning scenery, providing a deep connection with the ancient desert and its majestic beauty.

Optional Add-On:
Camel Ride and Hiking Tours can be added to any tour at any time.
hiking.description_tour_3:
Jebel Barada, known for its distinctive rock formations and ancient significance, stands proudly in the heart of Wadi Rum. The name "Barada" translates to "the waterfall" in Arabic, a nod to the area’s historical water sources that once sustained the desert's inhabitants. This peak has served as a pivotal landmark throughout history, guiding caravans and nomads across the arid landscape.

Start your half-day adventure from Wadi Rum village, where you’ll meet your guide and prepare for an exciting trek. We’ll drive you to the base of Jebel Barada, where the journey begins.

The trail winds through a fascinating mix of sandy paths and rugged rock formations, reflecting the diverse beauty of the desert. As you hike, your guide will share insights into the historical role of Jebel Barada, including its significance as a waypoint for ancient trade routes and its role in local legends.

Reaching the summit, you'll be rewarded with panoramic views that reveal the vastness and intricate patterns of the desert. The serene landscape, combined with the echoes of history, makes this hike a profound experience.

After taking in the spectacular scenery, we’ll return to Wadi Rum village, concluding a journey that offers a deep connection with the ancient echoes and timeless beauty of Wadi Rum.

Optional Add-On:
Camel Ride and Hiking Tours can be added to any tour at any time.

two_nights_tours.heading: 2 Days & 2 Night Tours
two_nights_tours.paragraph: Discover the magic of the Wadi Rum with our expert guides. From sweeping dunes to ancient caravan routes, we'll show you sights beyond your wildest dreams. Don't just visit the Wadi Rum - experience it with us.
two_nights_tours.description_tour_1:
**Discover the beauty and magic of Wadi Rum on this unforgettable two-night adventure.** You'll explore the desert's stunning landscapes, experience Bedouin culture, and sleep under a sky full of stars.

Night 1: Your journey begins as you arrive at a traditional Bedouin camp just in time to watch the sun set over the desert. Enjoy a delicious dinner of local dishes, followed by a cozy evening around the campfire. Listen to stories of the desert and relax under the twinkling stars before settling into your tent for the night.

Day 1: After breakfast, get ready for a full-day jeep tour through the most beautiful spots in Wadi Rum. Start with the vast Khor Al Ajram Valley, then visit Lawrence’s Spring, where you’ll learn about the history of Lawrence of Arabia. Next, climb the Red Sand Dune for amazing views of the desert.
Continue your adventure at Wadi Khazali (Khazali Canyon), where ancient carvings tell stories of the past. Visit the Little Rock Bridge and take a peaceful hike through Abu Khashaba Canyon.

The day’s highlight is the impressive Burdah Rock Bridge, the largest arch in Wadi Rum. Before heading back to camp, stop by the unique Mushroom Rock, shaped by the wind over many years.

During the day, you’ll enjoy a traditional Bedouin lunch with refreshing tea breaks. As the day ends, have dinner under the stars and get ready for another magical night in the desert.

Night 2: For your second night, you have a special treat—sleeping outside under the stars. Lay down on soft blankets and let the quiet of the desert surround you as you drift off to sleep beneath a sky full of shimmering stars. It's a night you’ll never forget.

Day 2: Start your morning with a hearty breakfast as the desert awakens around you. Spend the morning exploring more of Wadi Rum with another jeep tour or a hike, depending on what you feel like. This is your chance to soak in the peaceful beauty of the desert one last time before your adventure ends.
two_nights_tours.description_tour_2:
**Step into the heart of Wadi Rum and let the desert's ancient magic capture your soul.** This one-day, one-night journey is a perfect escape for those who wish to connect deeply with the serene beauty of the desert.

Day 1: Your adventure begins with a full-day jeep tour through the most breathtaking landscapes of Wadi Rum. Start in the wide and peaceful Khor Al Ajram Valley, where the vastness of the desert welcomes you. The tour takes you to Lawrence’s Spring, a vital water source that has refreshed Bedouins for generations. From there, explore the mystical Khazali Canyon, where ancient inscriptions whisper the stories of the past.

The journey continues to the towering Red Sand Dune, where you can climb to the top and marvel at the sweeping views of the desert. Visit the unique Little Rock Bridge and the famous Umm Fruth Rock Bridge, two natural wonders shaped by time and wind, perfect for capturing unforgettable photos. During the day, you’ll enjoy a traditional Bedouin lunch with refreshing tea breaks, giving you a taste of the desert's rich flavors.

Night 1: As the sun sets, return to your camp, where a special night awaits you. Choose to sleep in a cozy Bedouin tent or under the vast, star-filled sky. As the desert quiets down, let the gentle breeze and the sparkling stars lull you to sleep, creating memories you’ll cherish forever.

Day 2: Wake up to the soft light of dawn and a hearty breakfast, ready for a new adventure. Begin the day with a hike up Jebel Al Hash, a mountain that offers panoramic views of the endless desert. Later, visit the majestic Burdah Rock Bridge, one of Wadi Rum’s most famous landmarks. Capture the beauty and tranquility of the desert one last time before your journey comes to an end.

Night 2: After the day's exploration, return to the camp. You will enjoy another peaceful night under the stars or in a comfortable Bedouin tent, soaking in the tranquility of the desert night before concluding your adventure.
